definition: to send out/to show (one's feeling)/to issue/to develop/to make a bundle of money/classifier for gunshots (rounds)

sentences.english: At the news he was beside himself with anger.
sentences.chinese: 聽了這個消息他慣怒得幾乎發狂。

sentences.english: Poor Fido was ready to go out of his wits for joy.
sentences.chinese: 可憐的費多高興得幾乎要發狂了。

sentences.english: Gerhardt ran his hand through his reddish brown hair distractedly .
sentences.chinese: 葛哈德只是發狂似地拿手撓他那紅褐色的頭髮。

sentences.english: Away from the madding crowd, dust , smoke and din.
sentences.chinese: 遠離發狂的羣衆，灰塵，煙和喧囂。

sentences.english: I run as musk-deer in the shadow of the forest mad with his own perfume.
sentences.chinese: 我像麋鹿一樣在林蔭中奔走，爲着自己的香氣而發狂。

sentences.english: It encourages the would - be American poet to rely too exclusively on a rapt and bardic intuition.
sentences.chinese: 它鼓勵未來的美國詩人完全依靠發狂似的詩人的直覺。

sentences.english: He was maddened by the pain and jumped out of the window.
sentences.chinese: 痛苦把他折磨得發狂，他從窗子跳了出去。

sentences.english: Some people shout their love from the rooftops.
sentences.chinese: 有些爲愛發狂的瘋子會爬上屋頂大吼出心中所愛。

sentences.english: Across the country, female fans shivered and went limp.
sentences.chinese: 全美國的女影迷都爲瓦倫蒂諾神魂顛倒，顫抖發狂。

sentences.english: Driven to distraction, he murdered the woman who jilted him.
sentences.chinese: 他被逼得發狂，於是殺死了拋棄他的那個女人。

sentences.english: Ava had decided she wasn’t mad any more and so she sprayed the stairs with her perfume.
sentences.chinese: 艾娃決定不再發狂，於是在樓梯上噴灑香水。

sentences.english: I run as a musk-deer runs in the shadow of the forest mad with his own perfume.
sentences.chinese: 我像麝鹿一樣在林蔭中奔走，爲着自己的香氣而發狂。

sentences.english: He goes bananas about the novels by Qiongyao.
sentences.chinese: 瓊瑤的小說讓他迷到發狂的程度。

sentences.english: She goes bananas about the works by San Mao.
sentences.chinese: 三毛的作品讓她迷到發狂的程度。

sentences.english: The broken arm nearly crazed him with pain.
sentences.chinese: 那條斷臂幾乎使他痛得發狂。

definition: elated/light and airy feeling (after a few drinks)/smug and conceited/complacent
cannot figure out/to be unable to take a lighter view/to take things too hard/to be depressed/to fret over trifles
lit. heart distracted, thoughts in turmoil (idiom); distraught with anxiety
to rain curses (on sb)/to let sb have it/to bawl sb out
to gesticulate/to point out/to point the finger of blame
to sound out the difficulties and retreat to avoid defeat (idiom); fig. to back out of an awkward situation/to get out on finding out what it's really like
the cool eye of a bystander/a detached point of view
to show respect from a distance (idiom)/to remain at a respectful distance
